title: Job Openings at Stivlon Consulting
content:
Stivlon Consulting is yourstrategic partner in building high-performance teams and unlocking individual potential. We are passionate about finding the perfect fit—the talented individuals who elevate your company and the fulfilling career paths that ignite professional growth.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Corporate Communications Specialist

Job Location: Victoria Island, Lagos
Work Mode: Hybrid

Qualifications
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Bachelor’s or master’s degree in communications, Marketing, Public Relations, or related field.
	Minimum of 5 years of experience in communications, preferably in a nonprofit or youth-focused program.
	Proven experience in digital marketing, media relations, and social media management
	Experience promoting gender equality and inclusivity is highly desirable.
	Proficiency with social media platforms, content management systems, and data analytics tools.


Salary
N700,000- N900,000  monthly.

Application Closing Date: 8th July, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should their send their Resume to: stivlonjobs@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

 

 

2.) Interior Designer

Job Location: Nigeria

Job Summary


	We are looking for a talented and detail-oriented Interior Designer to create exceptional design solutions that align with client needs and brand standards.
	The ideal candidate will have strong technical knowledge, creativity, and the ability to manage projects from concept to completion.


Key Responsibilities


	Advise clients on space planning, layout, furnishing, and color coordination
	Analyze client briefs and prepare Bills of Quantities (BOQs) and control books
	Produce working drawings and specifications using AutoCAD, Revit, and related tools
	Conduct site measurements and oversee installation progress
	Coordinate with architects, engineers, contractors, and project teams
	Present design proposals and secure client approvals
	Research materials, design trends, and innovations
	Ensure all designs comply with brand standards
	Respond to client queries within 24 hours and ensure project satisfaction
	Collaborate with technical, customer service, and finance teams to align deliverables and payments
	Perform regular site inspections to ensure design integrity
	Gather and document client feedback, concerns, and complaints.


Qualifications


	Bachelor’s degree in Interior Design or Architecture
	Minimum of 3 years of relevant experience in a similar role
	A Master’s degree in Architecture is a plus


Key Attributes:


	Strong problem-solving and creativity
	High attention to detail and organization
	Ability to work independently and in teams
	Excellent interpersonal and communication skills
	Integrity, accountability, and adaptability under pressure


Technical Skills:


	Proficiency in AutoCAD, Revit, 3D Max, and presentation tools
	Skilled in layout, lighting, material selection, and visual composition
	Familiarity with Autodesk 3ds Max, CINEMA 4D, and video rendering tools
	Demonstrated experience in interior space planning and decoration


Knowledge Areas:


	Sales and marketing for design services
	Customer service best practices
	Engineering and construction basics relevant to interiors


Salary
N200,000 - N250,000 Monthly. (Slightly negotiable)

Application Closing Date: 4th July, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should their send their CV to: stivlonjobs@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

 

 

3.) Senior Sales Associate

Job Location: Lagos

Job Summary


	We’re looking for a results-driven Senior Sales Associate with proven retail experience to lead and support a dynamic sales team.
	The ideal candidate has a strong background in furniture, lifestyle, construction, or home retail, with a passion for customer satisfaction and team development.
	This role supports retail leadership by ensuring sales targets are met, driving showroom and e-commerce performance, and fostering a high-performance sales culture.


Key Responsibilities


	Supervise and guide the sales team, ensuring all members meet or exceed their individual and team targets
	Lead by example by engaging clients, closing sales, and managing customer relationships
	Track and report sales performance, team activity, and store trends to the Head of Retail
	Maintain a strong understanding of product offerings to provide expert guidance to customers and staff
	Ensure that all product listings are correctly uploaded, described, and updated on the e-commerce platform
	Resolve customer issues efficiently and professionally, providing quick, practical solutions
	Provide ongoing support and training to sales team members, fostering a culture of high performance and service excellence
	Assist in merchandising and showroom layout to optimize sales opportunities
	Use Microsoft Office tools (Excel, Word, PowerPoint) to prepare reports, team schedules, and sales tracking
	Work closely with marketing and inventory teams to align promotions, stock availability, and customer engagement strategies
	Build new client lists and identify retail opportunities.


Requirements & Qualifications


	Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Sales, Marketing, or related field
	Minimum of 5 years of retail sales experience, with at least 2 years in a supervisory or senior sales role
	Experience in a furniture or interior design company is highly desirable
	Proven ability to sell effectively and meet targets consistently
	Strong people management skills, with the ability to motivate and guide a team
	Excellent communication, negotiation, and problem-solving abilities
	Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite, especially Excel and PowerPoint
	Familiarity with e-commerce platforms and product content management is an added advantage
	Strong organizational skills and attention to detail.


Application Closing Date: 4th July, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should their send their CV to: stivlonjobs@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

title: Software-Defined Networking Engineer Job at Canonical Nigeria
content:
(adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    

Canonical - We deliver open source to the world faster, more securely, and more cost-effectively than any other company. We develop Ubuntu, the world’s most popular enterprise Linux from cloud to edge, together with a passionate global community of 200,000 contributors. Ubuntu means 'humanity to others. We chose it because it embodies the generosity at the heart of open source, the new normal for platforms and innovation. Together with a community of 200,000, we publish an operating system that runs from the tiny connected devices up to the world's biggest mainframes, the platform that everybody uses on the public cloud, and the workstation experience of the world's most productive developers. Secure and reliable, elegant and intuitive, and open for innovation - Ubuntu is the future of open source, which is why it's the fastest-growing Linux in the world despite already being the most widely deployed.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Software-Defined Networking Engineer
Job Location: Lagos
Job type: Full time

What your day will look like


	Work with the most advanced operating systems and network application technologies available
	Collaborate with public clouds and network silicon providers
	Design and implement the best software-defined networking experience for the latest hardware platforms and software stacks
	Write high-quality, well-designed and well-documented software
	Contribute to shape innovative product strategies 
	Debug issues and produce high-quality code to fix them
	Collaborate proactively with a globally distributed organisation
	Contribute to technical documentation to make it the best of its kind
	Display technical leadership internally, towards our partners, and in the open source communities
	Influence open-source projects and communities
	Shape software-define networking products for evolving data centre architectures to meet ever-increasing bandwidth, reliability, security, and interoperability demands
	Work from home, with global travel twice a year for company events of up to two weeks duration


What we are looking for in you


	An exceptional academic track record from both high school and university
	Undergraduate degree in Computer Science or STEM, or a compelling narrative about your alternative path
	Drive and a track record of going above-and-beyond expectations
	Knowledge of networking: architecture, design, and protocols
	Deep understanding of Linux networking, from kernel to user space
	Fluency in at least one of Golang, C/C++, Rust or Python
	Professional written and spoken English 
	Experience with Linux (Debian or Ubuntu preferred) 
	Excellent interpersonal skills, curiosity, flexibility, and accountability 
	Passion, thoughtfulness, and self-motivation 
	Excellent communication and presentation skills 
	Result-oriented, with a personal drive to meet commitments 
	Ability to travel twice a year, for company events up to two weeks each


Additional skills that you might also bring:


	Familiarity with existing open source networking technologies - kernel (including eBPF, AF_XDP), OVS, OVN, SoNIC, DENT, Switchdev, DPDK, SPDK, 5G 3GPP, ONF stack, iwd, NetworkManager, etc.
	Familiarity with data path hardware acceleration protocols and interfaces, such as RDMA, RoCE, iWARP, NVMe, SR-IOV
	Computer architecture knowledge of x86, ARM, and RISC-V
	Experience in complex IP network engineering and implementation
	Experience with virtualization technologies, e.g., QEMU, KVM, etc.
	Previous contribution to open source projects and community involvement
	Familiarity with Kubernetes, Cloud-native Network Functions, and Container Network Interface plugins
	Performance engineering and security experience.


What we offer colleagues


	We consider geographical location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide.
	We revisit compensation annually (and more often for graduates and associates) to ensure we recognise outstanding performance.
	In addition to base pay, we offer a performance-driven annual bonus.
	We provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals.
	We balance our programs to meet local needs and ensure fairness globally.
	Distributed work environment with twice-yearly team sprints in person
	Personal learning and development budget of USD 2,000 per year
	Annual compensation review
	Recognition rewards
	Annual holiday leave
	Maternity and paternity leave
	Employee Assistance Programme
	Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues
	Priority Pass, and travel upgrades for long haul company

title: Finance Manager Job at Equity Specialist Hospital
content:
Equity Specialist Hospital is a modern medical facility in Lagos, Nigeria, committed to providing world-class, patient-centered care. Backed by Equity Health Group, the hospital offers advanced diagnostic and therapeutic services across key specialties, using cutting-edge medical technology. Its mission is to make high-quality healthcare accessible locally while reducing medical tourism.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Finance Manager

Job Location: Lekki, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Industry: Healthcare

Job Description
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Are you a seasoned finance professional with strong leadership capabilities and a passion for making a difference in healthcare?
	Equity Specialist Hospitals is seeking a highly motivated and strategic Finance Manager to lead our Finance Department. As a key member of the hospital’s leadership team, you will play a pivotal role in ensuring financial sustainability, enhancing operational efficiency, and supporting strategic growth. Prior healthcare experience is required.


Key Responsibilities


	Lead the preparation and management of annual budgets, forecasts, and long-term financial plans aligned with the hospital's objectives.
	Prepare accurate and timely financial reports; analyze variances and trends; provide actionable insights to aid decision-making.
	Oversee billing, insurance claims processing, accounts receivable, vendor payments, and cash flow optimization.
	Ensure full compliance with tax regulations, financial reporting standards, and healthcare industry-specific financial requirements.
	Supervise and mentor the finance team; assign roles, monitor performance, and strengthen internal controls.
	Monitor departmental expenditures, identify opportunities for cost savings, and recommend process improvements.
	Present financial updates to senior leadership; support funding proposals; liaise with auditors, banks, and regulatory bodies.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree in Finance, Accounting, Economics or related field (MBA or professional certification like ICAN, ACCA is an added advantage).
	Minimum of 4 years of progressive finance experience, preferably in the healthcare or service industry.
	Strong leadership, communication, and strategic thinking skills.
	Proficiency in financial software and MS Excel.
	Sound knowledge of financial regulations and healthcare industry standards.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and Cover Letter to: hr@equityng.com using "Finance Manager" as the subject of the email.

title: Insurance Manager Job at Unicane Industries FZE
content:
Unicane Industries FZE is the largest renner of Ethanol in Africa and also into production of Soya Oil and plastics Manufacturing. we seek experienced insurance professional to join our team. 

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Insurance Manager

Job Location: Jamata Village, Lokoja LGA, Kogi 
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are seeking an experienced Insurance Manager to manage and oversee all insurance-related matters for our large manufacturing enterprise.
	The successful candidate will be responsible for ensuring adequate insurance coverage for our fleet, workplace compensation, manufacturing equipment, and other business assets.


Key Responsibilities
Insurance Policy Management:


	Develop and implement insurance strategies to mitigate risks.
	Manage and negotiate insurance policies for fleet, workplace compensation, equipment, and other business assets.
	Ensure compliance with regulatory requirements.


Risk Assessment and Management:


	Identify and assess potential risks to the organization.
	Develop and implement risk management strategies to minimize losses.


Claims Management:


	Handle insurance claims and ensure timely settlement.
	Liaise with insurance providers and other stakeholders.


Fleet Insurance:


	Manage fleet insurance policies and ensure compliance with regulatory requirements.
	Handle claims and negotiate settlements.


Workplace Compensation:


	Manage workers' compensation insurance and ensure compliance with regulatory requirements.
	Handle claims and negotiate settlements.


Equipment and Asset Insurance:


	Manage insurance policies for manufacturing equipment and other business assets.
	Ensure adequate coverage and handle claims.


Insurance Compliance:


	Ensure compliance with regulatory requirements and industry standards.
	Stay up-to-date with changes in insurance laws and regulations.


Requirements
Qualifications:


	Bachelor's Degree in Insurance, Risk Management, Business Administration, or related field.
	Professional insurance certifications (e.g., Chartered Insurance Institute of Nigeria (CIIN)) are an advantage.


Experience:


	Minimum of 5 years experience in insurance management, preferably in a manufacturing or industrial setting.
	Proven track record of managing complex insurance issues.


Skills:


	Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
	Excellent communication and negotiation skills.
	Ability to work independently and as part of a team.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their application including Resume and Cover Letter to: eon@africa.industriesusing the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

Note: If you are a motivated and experienced insurance professional looking for a challenging role, please apply.

title: Project Manager - Active Telecommunication Infrastructure Engineer Job at Snowview Support Services Limited
content:
Snowview Support Services Limited (SSSL) is a leading infrastructure support company headquartered in Port Harcourt, Nigeria, with core operations in telecommunications and oil & gas.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Project Manager - Active Telecommunication Infrastructure Engineer

Job Location: Port Harcourt, Rivers
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Responsibilities
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Lead the end-to-end management of telecom infrastructure projects (BTS, Microwave Radio, GSM networks)
	Supervise project officers, field engineers, and subcontractors to ensure deliverables align with project goals
	Develop project plans, timelines, and budgets, and track progress against key milestones
	Coordinate resource allocation and ensure optimal use of technical, human, and material resources
	Ensure timely installation, commissioning, and integration of network components (active telecom equipment)
	Identify risks and develop contingency plans to address schedule delays, technical issues, or budget constraints
	Oversee the implementation of network designs and validate system performance through test results
	Conduct project reviews, documentation audits, and post-implementation evaluations
	Liaise with clients, vendors, and cross-functional teams for seamless execution and project handover
	Stay up to date on new telecom technologies and recommend solutions for continuous improvement


Requirements


	B.Eng./B.Sc. in Electrical/Electronic, Telecoms, or related field; PMP or PRINCE2 certification preferred.
	Minimum 4 years of hands-on telecom rollout/Operations & Maintenance experience with at least 2 years in a supervisory Project or Program Management role.
	Strong command of GSM, LTE/5G RAN, microwave backhaul, IP routing/switching, and site power systems (genset, DC plant, battery banks).
	Proven budget control, vendor management, and advanced Excel/MS Project (or Primavera) skills.


Key Skills:


	Project Management: Excellent planning, budgeting, and scheduling skills using tools like MS Project or Primavera.
	Technical Knowledge: Deep understanding of GSM/LTE infrastructure, microwave backhaul, IP routing/switching, and site power systems.
	Leadership & Communication: Strong supervisory skills, able to lead multidisciplinary teams and communicate across all organizational levels.
	Problem Solving: Analytical mindset to resolve complex rollout, integration, and O&M issues.
	Analytical Skills: Ability to analyze network performance data and identify areas for improvement.
	Documentation & Reporting: Skilled in writing reports and appropriate documentation.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and a cover letter to: recruitment@snowviewssl.com using “Application - Project Manager (Active Telecommunication Infrastructure Maintenance)” as the subject of the email.
